arts.ttl: France vs Iceland – The French lineup according to the press: a 4-2-3-1 or 4-4-2 formation, with Barcola starting.

arts.sum: France and Iceland collide in Paris on Tuesday, with both teams fired up for their second outing in the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers. After perfect starts to their campaigns, expect fireworks when the group favourites take on Iceland in the City of Light. arts.ttl: France vs Iceland – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: France and Iceland go head-to-head in the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers on Tuesday. Both sides will be looking to build on their opening matchday victories, with France seeking to take early control of Group D after their 2-0 win over Ukraine. arts.ttl: Inter Milan Star Striker To Start In France Vs Iceland World Cup Qualifier Amid Injuries To Paris Saint-Germain Duo
arts.sum: Inter Milan star Marcus Thuram could start in tonight’s FIFA World Cup qualifying clash between France and Iceland. According to L’Equipe via FCInterNews, the 28-year-old is the favorite to partner up with Kylian Mbappe in the final third. arts.ttl: France vs Iceland – The French lineup announced in 4-4-2 with Barcola
arts.sum: This Tuesday, France will play against Iceland in the 2026 World Cup qualifiers at 8:45 p.m. CET at the Parc des Princes. The match involves three Paris Saint-Germain players, all French: Lucas Chevalier, Lucas Hernandez, and Bradley Barcola. L’Équipe reports a likely starting lineup with Barcola included.
